sentences.en: A methane molecule is composed of one carbon atom attached to four hydrogens.
sentences.cn: 甲烷分子由1个碳原子与4个氢原子构成。

sentences.en: A neutron is simply a neutral particle in the nucleus of an atom.
sentences.cn: 中子就是原子核里不带电的粒子。

sentences.en: After hydrogen, the atom with the simplest structure is that of helium.
sentences.cn: 在氢元素之后, 氦的原子结构最简单.

sentences.en: An atom bomb would destroy a city.
sentences.cn: 一颗原子弹能摧毁一座城市。

sentences.en: For many years the atom was believed to be indivisible.
sentences.cn: 在过去有很多年原子一直被认为是不可分割的.

sentences.en: He could not get up an atom of sympathy for her.
sentences.cn: 他对她激不出一点同情心.

sentences.en: He patented the idea that the atom could be split.
sentences.cn: 他获得了“原子可以再分”这一概念的专利权。

sentences.en: Neutrons and protons are bound together in the nucleus of an atom.
sentences.cn: 在原子核里，中子和质子是结合在一起的。

sentences.en: The neutrons and protons form the core of the atom.
sentences.cn: 中子和质子构成了原子核.

sentences.en: The nucleus of an atom consists of neutrons, protons and other particles.
sentences.cn: 原子核由中子 、 质子和其他粒子构成.

sentences.en: The power of the atom can be used to produce electricity.
The V2 was not an ordinary weapon: it could only be used against cities. Likewise the atom bomb.
sentences.cn: V2火箭并非普通武器：它只能用于对付城市。原子弹也是这样。

sentences.en: This jump means that the atom has absorbed some energy.
sentences.cn: 这种跳跃意味着原子吸收了某些能量.
